metadata.subject: J.P. Morgan exclusive conference call on Thursday, November 8th at 4pm EST: "Post-election insight: The road ahead"

organizations: U.S. Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works
Atlantic Council of the United States
Center for Strategic and International Studies
Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation Forum (APEC) Business Advisory Council

relationships.description: Executive Vice President and Head of Corporate Responsibility
Former U.S. Special Trade Negotiator and Ambassador
Former Chief of Staff to Senator Max Baucus

analysis.purpose: To invite clients to an exclusive conference call discussing post-election political and fiscal implications
analysis.significance: Shows J.P. Morgan providing political analysis to private banking clients using high-level government-connected executives

notable_quotes: Peter is an undisputed expert in political matters, having spent nearly a decade in government service as U.S. Special Trade Negotiator and Ambassador in the Clinton administrations.
This call is for educational purposes only. JPMC does not endorse any candidate or political party. It is not permissible to forward this information to anyone else.

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present

illegal_activity.description: Standard corporate communication about a conference call

public_knowledge.context: Standard corporate event invitation that would be typical for private banking clients

analysis.summary: J.P. Morgan Private Bank is inviting clients to an exclusive conference call featuring Peter Scher, Head of Corporate Responsibility and former Clinton administration trade ambassador, to discuss post-election political and fiscal implications including the 'fiscal cliff' legislation and global economic impacts.
